sum_force.f90

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 !  ===================================================================
00002 !
00003 !                              SUM_FORCE
00004 !
00005 !   Calculate forces of particle from interaction list
00006 !
00007 !  ===================================================================
00008 
00009 subroutine sum_force( p, n, inode, eps, sumfx, sumfy, sumfz, sumphi, load )
00010   use treevars
00011   implicit none
00012   integer, intent(in) :: p  ! particle label 
00013   integer, intent(in) :: n  !  # terms on interaction list
00014   integer, dimension(1:n) ::  inode
00015   real, intent(in) :: eps ! smoothing parameter
00016   real, intent(out) :: load ! work load for particle p
00017   integer :: jnode, i,j,k 
00018 
00019   real*8 :: rd,dx,dy,dz,d,dx2,dy2,dz2 
00020  real*8 :: dx3,dy3,dz3,rd3,rd5,rd7,fd1,fd2,fd3,fd4,fd5,fd6
00021  real*8 :: fsx,fsy,fsz,phi
00022  real*8, dimension(n*10) :: mult 
00023  real*8, dimension(n*3) :: coc
00024   real*8, intent(out) ::  sumfx,sumfy,sumfz,sumphi 
00025   real :: eps2
00026 
00027   eps2=eps**2
00028   sumfx = 0.
00029   sumfy = 0.
00030   sumfz = 0.
00031   sumphi = 0.
00032 
00033 ! copy multipole moments into stride 1 array
00034   do j=1,n
00035     jnode=inode(j)
00036     i = (j-1)*10+1
00037     k = (j-1)*3+1
00038     coc(k) = xcoc(jnode)
00039     coc(k+1) = ycoc(jnode)
00040     coc(k+2) = zcoc(jnode)
00041     mult(i) = charge(jnode)
00042     mult(i+1) = xdip(jnode)
00043     mult(i+2) = ydip(jnode)
00044     mult(i+3) = zdip(jnode)
00045     mult(i+4) = xxquad(jnode)
00046     mult(i+5) = yyquad(jnode)
00047     mult(i+6) = zzquad(jnode)
00048     mult(i+7) = xyquad(jnode)
00049     mult(i+8) = yzquad(jnode)
00050     mult(i+9) = zxquad(jnode)
00051   end do
00052 
00053   call delay(me,0)
00054 !  write(*,*) p,' x_p=',x(p)
00055   do j=1,n
00056      
00057   !  preprocess distances
00058      i = 10*(j-1) + 1  ! multipole index
00059      k = 3*(j-1) + 1  ! coc index
00060 !     jnode=inode(j)
00061 !     dx = x(p) - xcoc(jnode)
00062 !     dy = y(p) - ycoc(jnode)
00063 !     dz = z(p) - zcoc(jnode) 
00064      dx = x(p) - coc(k)
00065      dy = y(p) - coc(k+1)
00066      dz = z(p) - coc(k+2) 
00067 
00068      d = sqrt(dx**2+dy**2+dz**2+eps2)
00069      rd = 1./d
00070      rd3 = rd**3
00071      rd5 = rd**5
00072      rd7 = rd**7
00073 
00074      dx2 = dx**2
00075      dy2 = dy**2
00076      dz2 = dz**2
00077      dx3 = dx**3
00078      dy3 = dy**3
00079      dz3 = dz**3
00080 
00081      fd1 = 3.*dx2*rd5 - rd3
00082      fd2 = 3.*dy2*rd5 - rd3
00083      fd3 = 3.*dz2*rd5 - rd3
00084      fd4 = 3.*dx*dy*rd5
00085      fd5 = 3.*dy*dz*rd5
00086      fd6 = 3.*dx*dz*rd5
00087 
00088      ! potential
00089 
00090      sumphi = sumphi + mult(i)*rd    &                           !  monopole term
00091           ! 
00092      + (dx*mult(i+1) + dy*mult(i+2) + dz*mult(i+3))*rd3  &    !  dipole 
00093         !     Dx             Dy            Dz
00094      + 0.5*fd1*mult(i+4) + 0.5*fd2*mult(i+5) + 0.5*fd3*mult(i+6)  &  !  quadrupole
00095         !           Qxx                 Qyy                 Qzz
00096      + fd4*mult(i+7) + fd5*mult(i+8) + fd6*mult(i+9)      
00097            !   Qxy            Qyz             Qzx
00098 
00099      !  forces
00100 
00101      sumfx = sumfx + mult(i)*dx*rd3 &      ! monopole term
00102           !
00103           + fd1*mult(i+1) + fd4*mult(i+2) + fd6*mult(i+3)   &   !  dipole term
00104           !
00105           + (15.*dx3*rd7 - 9.*dx*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+4) &     !
00106           + ( 15.*dy*dx2*rd7 - 3.*dy*rd5 )*mult(i+7) &     !
00107           + ( 15.*dz*dx2*rd7 - 3.*dz*rd5 )*mult(i+9) &     !   quadrupole term
00108           + ( 15*dx*dy*dz*rd7 )*mult(i+8) &                ! 
00109           + ( 15.*dx*dy2*rd7 - 3.*dx*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+5) & !
00110           + ( 15.*dx*dz2*rd7 - 3.*dx*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+6)   !
00111 
00112      sumfy = sumfy + mult(i)*dy*rd3 &
00113           + fd2*mult(i+2) + fd4*mult(i+1) + fd5*mult(i+3)  &
00114           + ( 15.*dy3*rd7 - 9.*dy*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+5) &
00115           + ( 15.*dx*dy2*rd7 - 3.*dx*rd5 )*mult(i+7) &
00116           + ( 15.*dz*dy2*rd7 - 3.*dz*rd5 )*mult(i+8) &
00117           + ( 15.*dx*dy*dz*rd7 )*mult(i+9) &
00118           + ( 15.*dy*dx2*rd7 - 3.*dy*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+4) &
00119           + ( 15.*dy*dz2*rd7 - 3.*dy*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+6) 
00120 
00121      sumfz = sumfz + mult(i)*dz*rd3 &
00122           + fd3*mult(i+3) + fd5*mult(i+2) + fd6*mult(i+1)  &
00123           + ( 15.*dz3*rd7 - 9.*dz*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+6) &
00124           + ( 15.*dx*dz2*rd7 - 3.*dx*rd5 )*mult(i+9) &
00125           + ( 15.*dy*dz2*rd7 - 3.*dy*rd5 )*mult(i+8) &
00126           + ( 15.*dx*dy*dz*rd7 )*mult(i+7) &
00127           + ( 15.*dz*dy2*rd7 - 3.*dz*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+5) &
00128           + ( 15.*dz*dx2*rd7 - 3.*dz*rd5 )*0.5*mult(i+4) 
00129 
00130 !     write(*,'(i5,a5,f12.3,a5,f12.3,a5,f12.3)') jnode,' q_j=',charge(jnode),' x_j=',xcoc(jnode),' d=',d
00131 
00132   end do
00133 
00134   ! work load - can make this for accurate by sorting leaf/twig terms
00135 
00136   work(p) = n    ! store for next domain decomp
00137   load = work(p)  ! return to calling routine
00138 end subroutine sum_force
